meanings.definition: Excessive fondness for eating and drinking.
meanings.sent1: Her gourmandise for sweets led her to eat a whole cake in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: His gourmandise for pizza always made him order an extra-large for himself.
meanings.sent3: Despite his gourmandise, he couldn't finish the giant burger challenge at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: Her gourmandise for adventure took her on a culinary journey around the world.
meanings.sent5: The gourmandise of the chef was evident in every decadent dish he prepared.

meanings.definition: The act or practice of indulging in rich or luxurious food and drink.
meanings.sent1: Their gourmandise at the buffet knew no bounds as they piled their plates high.
meanings.sent2: The royal feast was a display of extravagant gourmandise by the nobles.
meanings.sent3: The gourmandise at the chocolate factory tour left everyone in a delightful sugar coma.
meanings.sent4: In the land of dreams, gourmandise was the currency of the realm.
meanings.sent5: The gourmandise of the banquet was a feast for both the stomach and the eyes.
